è¯¦æƒ…å¯ä»¥å‚è€ƒå¤–æ–‡è§£ç­”ï¼šhttps://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/4700/what-is-the-difference-between-fixed-effect-random-effect-and-mixed-effect-mode

é—®é¢˜ï¼šDifference between random effetcs and dummy coding of a categorical variableï¼š
Aï¼šYour dummy coding models are just treating BB as a fixed effect. You should read some basic discussions of fixed vs random effects. Briefly, treating BB as random means that you assume that Î³iÎ³i are sampled from an underlying normal distribution, and you fit its mean and variance instead of fitting every single Î³i
ï¼ˆref: https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/310089/difference-between-random-effetcs-and-dummy-coding-of-a-categorical-variable
